website_summaries.verdict: Designed for minivans and SUVs, this soft cargo box is an affordable choice for those who travel only a few times a year.
pros: Price is similar to WeatherTech, but capacity is larger
cons: Must be completely filled to maintain structural integrity

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, crappy instructions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a long distance move. The instructions were pretty much useless and I could not figure out how to secure it to my car so I called a friend who eventually figured it out. Turns out the supplied clips did not fit on my Jetta so he somehow modified the straps to make fit. Once loaded properly, it was very secure and did not move around while driving at highway speed. It is very roomy and holds a lot of stuff. I did not waste the $20 on cargo mat, I used a yoga mat which did the job perfectly. If you don't have one then buy one for $5 at 5 Below!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mac

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 2nd use.
customer_reviews.text: Ripped after 2nd use. Upon fastening the bag down for the return home, the material where the front buckles attach to the bag ripped off on both sides. I was being careful and the pull to tighten the straps was modest, just enough to secure the bag. I have stored the bag indoors and taken good care of it. None-the-less, it appeared to be very brittle. It was not fun thinking about how the bag was barely secured to the vehicle on the way home. Also of note, the zipper becomes very difficult to operate as the plastic coating also begins to peal off. Move on and find a better bag, don't put yourself in the same position.
customer_reviews.author: tby

customer_reviews.title: Overall Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: Loved how well this worked for my 2018 Hyundai Santa Fe. I don't have a roof rack so I had to clip it to the door frames. Only bad part was I had to remove some of the weather stripping by pulling it down in order to hook it. The hooks will not go over the weather stripping like shown in the pictures. Other than that, I only had to check it twice as recommended by other purchasers. Even checking twice the straps remained tight through the whole trip. 6 hours going above 70 mph and through rain and it worked great with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Basking

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, needs more tie down points.
customer_reviews.text: We've now used this on two separate trips. I tied the thing down with actual ratcheting cargo straps since the ones that come with this back are worthless. The bag is just ok. It needs extra mount / tie down points in the front to keep it from lifting in the wind... I don't understand why all these bags seem to have this design flaw... If it had tie downs in the front just like the ones that are in the back, it would keep the whole bag a lot more secure...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drive across the country. Unfortunately it didn't make it the entire way. The cloth section had a hole ripped in it and the seam at one corner started to unravel. The loops for the straps didn't look like they would last too much longer either. We made sure that the corners were full and the bag would not be flapping in the wind. The bag stayed put the entire time and we didn't have to adjust it, but having to duct tape a brand new luggage bag is kind of ridiculous. For the price I expected to be able to use this bag over and over again. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny A

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sits happily on a Honda Fit and was great for camping
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on a Honda Fit for multiple camping trips. Used the non skid roof pad and buckled down to the inside of the door frame. Really tough material that seemed pretty water proof on the few trips we've had during the rain. When you pack things in the velcro pads are pretty useless but still we had no water troubles. Make sure you point the zipper close to the back side and with that we've had no trouble. I got a tiny lock as a general deterrent when we stopped at places. Was perfect for shoving in sleeping bags and soft bulky items on our camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: tissak

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Honda CRV. We purchased this to use for our family vacation. I CANNOT BELIEVE how much stuff we were able to put in it! We put two large suitcases, blankets, my son's baseball bag and bat, a beach shovel, and pillows. It was easy to put on the car and take it off. We also used it last week when we moved our daughter to college. Again, we were so happy to have all of the extra space. It rained the night before we left, after we had packed the car. Everything was dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Your Time or Risk
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to slap on the roof but not more than 50 miles down the highway, when we pulled over for a pit stop, found that all four straps had loosened and one was not far from coming undone completely. Not our first time at this rodeo so we did it right. The teeth just didn't hold. We can still use it as it is somewhat water proof (we passed through a rain storm on way back home and a couple of items did get wet) by placing in the trailer. Zippers are heavy duty but a bit*h to close. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storage!
customer_reviews.text: This roof storage was perfect for my family of three. It easily packed everything we needed for a week at the beach. The only issue we ran into was we put more in the car than we did in the storage on our way home and once we hit about 60 mph it made a LOUD noise. So we stopped and stuffed more into it and it was fine the rest of the way home! So make sure you pack it as full as possible, especially each corner! We put it on top of my Lexus RX350!
customer_reviews.author: Staci Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for long travel
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help us get luggage out of the inside of the car and it was a dream. Traveling with multiple children and pets, this gave us so much more legroom while we traveled. Don't let the pictures fool you, this carrier can hold more than you think. We had Two large suitcases, 4 sleeping bags, 2 small carry on's, golf clubs, and more in this carrier and still had room to spare. Cannot recommend this carrier enough!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Northup

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk! Lasted like 3 hours on the highway before it ripped apart!
customer_reviews.text: After a mere 3 hours on highway, totally ripped apart! Made me stop for an hour to try to tape it up, then tape came off, then stopped again to tape again! VERY disappointed! JUNK!! Even ripped along seams in the BACK of the bag. I mean - total, total junk. Was I the unlucky guy because I saw lots of good reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Philip J Berenz

customer_reviews.title: Collapsible but poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Do you only reason why I gave us three stars is that there aren’t enough straps to tie down the flaps (very noisy while driving), it really needs corner dividers so you know where to position bags and how much room you have. Tips: Use cardboard to connect the corners which will provide an outline to the bag and reduce corner flapping and additional tiedown straps to go across the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Adamovic

customer_reviews.title: Needs sturdier stitching.
customer_reviews.text: This carrier seemed very sturdy, but you do have to drive much slower than normal if you want to keep it in place. I feel like the stitching on this carrier (that the straps run though) needs to be much sturdier. My carrier, which was well packed - not too heavy, but heavy enough that it should have stayed in place - ripped away from the straps and flew off the back of the van while I was driving down the highway at the speed limit. (I never got it back...by the time I turned around someone had already taken it and never turned it in or called the police.)
customer_reviews.author: diverlady13

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! Secure, easy install.
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT! I drove over 400 miles with this loaded down on top of my KIA Sorento and it didn't budge! I listened to other reviews and placed a yoga mat between it and my roof to protect my car. It worked perfect. I don't have roof racks, so I used the straps it came with and they worked great. This saved me having to use a small Uhaul.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof performer with large capacity and great aerodynamics
customer_reviews.text: One of the best performing products I've ever bought. If you follow the directions for securing the Velcro over the zipper you can forget about any moisture getting inside. This did not let in a drop during several periods of rain while driving nor when rained on all night while parked. I found the effect on gas mileage to be negligible when you packed the smaller items up front and used the aerodynamic properties built into the design. I used a piece of a carpet mat under the carrier and found the straps to secure it easy to use and very functional. I would recommend this for anyone needing a large capacity waterproof carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Putter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for cars without rack.
customer_reviews.text: This was really scary in the beginning because we didn't have a rack on my 2013 Mazda 3. We didn't want to spend $400 just before our trip. We took a trip to Washington to Utah. The key is to distribute the weight evenly on the bag so you don't get a scary noise when the wind hits the bag. Also to tighten everything good. We had extra ropes but honestly don't think we needed it. That was Just for extra protection. I recommend buying a non slip mat we got from Amazon to reduce scratches and slippage. Happy trip!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Buy additional tie-downs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last minute when I was moving from Boston to Arizona. The car top carrier itself is great! It's very spacious and it kept all of my things dry when I got caught in lake effect snow and several storms on my drive. Be sure to buy extra tie-downs though. The little straps that come with the package may suffice for light driving, but if you're going on the freeway those little things are not going to hold up. Also I absolutely recommend getting the non-skid pad they suggest as it will help keep things in place and you won't scratch up your roof.
customer_reviews.author: Dana D

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmenship
customer_reviews.text: Was debating on getting hard shell vs this . Decided to go with the cheaper option. Filled it up and has it on my car . Secured on my vehicle which two other people checked . I was going down the highway the strap ripped off and this came flying off my vehicle on the highway . Initially I thought the fault was mine until I inspected the bag and realized the fabric ripped. Imagine this flying down the highway. Luckily most of my items were just a little tattered but no one was injured or killed behind me when it fell on the road. I would like refunded or I'll be disputing this charge.
customer_reviews.author: Chase reed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product if you like other cars honking at you and pointing at your roof
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a SUV without a roof rack. Bought and used the roof pad as recommended. Followed all the (very poorly) written instructions . This carrier was awful!! Could not get it to secure tightly no matter what we did. The roof pad was a joke, did not do anything. We finally had to stop about 4 hours into a 8 hour trip to unpack it, cram everything into our vehicle and have me,my wife,2 kids and 2 dogs squeeze into it and drive the remaining 4 hours like we were in a clown car. Might be OK if you vehicle has a roof rack, but if not STAY AWAY!!.
customer_reviews.author: tdeal11

customer_reviews.title: Worked as designed, seems sturdy enough,
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a little extra space moving the kid to college. Did just that, held fine, seems sturdy enough, secures easily, Four stars is becouse the zipper sticks in corner. Manufactures era with the zipper install. There are two zippers so it is easily work around. Just would have been nicer to have full range from both zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Tore while tightening straps
customer_reviews.text: For our first trip, this was AWESOME. For the second, one of the straps got loose, and then when we pulled over to tighten it, it tore as we were pulling the strap right. Will try to reach out to manufacturer to see if the warranty will cover it, but right now we’re just really disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly sturdy and definitely water proof. Over all I am happy with this, but we've only used it once so far. It fits 3 oversized duffel bags with room to spare; you maybe could fit a fourth, but you can definitely add all your boots up there with just the 3 bags. We used it for our family of 6 on a trip skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to our problem!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to bring home a ton of luggage from down south but didn’t want to put it in the car so the dogs had the entire back seat to themselves. This solved all our problems! We fit 2 carry on suitcases and 2 or 3 duffle bags also. Checked it a couple times at rest stops and never had to tighten it. Will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Alaska to Arizona
customer_reviews.text: I used mine for our move from Alaska to Arizona. Overall I was pleased with the bag. I drove through rain and some snow with no issues to the contents in the bag. I did not have a roof rack but I routed the straps through the mounting points on my jeep compass so I did not need to go through the inside of the vehicle. My only qualm was the way this thing would catch wind like a sail. I also noticed a bit of a drop in my MPGs. Overall through it got the job done as I have no permanent need for a hard case carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Dry gear!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to fit in our rack rather than attach it to our bars or roof so i dont know how it would hold up installed like that. We kept it secured in our rack with a cargo net we already had. The reason we purchased was to keep our camp gear dry. We had been using a tarp previously. This was much easier to just throw everything in. Its been great in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: JenRuss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Used this on our trip home from Florida to Nova Scotia, Canada. Works as described. Highly recommend it. We bought the mat too. Worked well also. Easy to store. Folds up into a small bag which is provided with purchase.. It is a bit noisey in the car as we don't have a roof rack on our Nissan, Altima but you got used to it. Lots of room in it. So easy to install. Takes only a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE FOR TRIPS IN SMALL CARS
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to get my son to college since we have a Rav4 with a 3/4 fold down seat and it did the job! It is a soft cover so we only put "soft stuff" on roof - bags of towels, sheets, flexible laundry basket, pillows, etc. We filled it corner to corner as recommended and strapping it after filling it was not only easy it was very safe and strong. It was also easy to take off the roof after we emptied it and stores right back in the bag they provide. We literally could not have driven there with one car if we didn't have this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fox

customer_reviews.title: Really good product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! We used it for vacation and this thing didn't budge! Ones we have purchased before we have had to duct tape the straps and you could hear it buzzing in the wind from inside the car. You couldn't hear this one and we were able to fit lots of items in it. It also did not mean when it rained! Definitely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: Large, not durable
customer_reviews.text: We loved this when we bought it as it is huge, easy to install and holds a LOT! However, the very first time we used it, it got a small hole. We drove from Florida to Indiana straight through and noticed the hole when we disassembled it. Unfortunately, we were pat our return window so have to buy a patch kit or figure out another way to salvage it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal product! We bought this for our move from Alaska to Texas, this product we fit perfectly on our Honda van and secured 2 large luggage bags, two medium gym bags, 5 back packs, a toddler fire truck toy (kids sit on a ride) and we still had some room. Didn’t have a single issue with this product. We drove mostly at 70 mph and even 80 at times and this remained secure with all belongings inside safe and sound. 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BSprime31

customer_reviews.title: The noise drove me right off the highway!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loaded it just like the instructions said, but as soon as I got the car up to 40 mph, the noise from the straps was unbelievable. Also, it rained the night before I left, and the area around each strap, where they attach to the moulding of the windows, leaked like a sieve!!! And, YES, I attached them just like the instructions said too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Will recommend
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for us! I was worried when we hit hours of heavy rainfall that there would be leakage. Everything stayed dry! The rest of our trip was at 75-85 mph with no issues with flapping or slipping! We did have a run in with a low parking garage... tired and in a hurry we made contact and it ripped the front 2 tie downs off and our beach umbrella shot or the back end. It didn't break the zipper! I felt this carrier was appropriately durable and water resistant. Even though i ruined it, i will be buying another!
customer_reviews.author: Werner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, don’t pass
customer_reviews.text: Broke this bag in with a 4,000 mile trip that consisted of rain and then 100 degree temperatures! This bag was awesome. Very easy to install and I felt very confident in the straps. Zipper is extremely well made, can be tough to unzip but that’s because the waterproof making is legit. We stuffed this bag to the brim. Didn’t even notice any more sound in the car due to bag! We had zero issues with this bag and couldn’t be more impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Becker

customer_reviews.title: Good product ,Good price
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a cross country move. We had no problems with it at all. Even driving through rain all of the contents remained dry. Since we knew we were going to be driving hundreds of miles a day at a decent speed we ended up putting a few extra straps of our own onto it just to make sure it was secure. It did not damage our roof at all. We had no damage to it after the trip unlike the cheap ones that will rip at the seams. All I can say is we had this thing stuffed full and it did its job.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic Threads

customer_reviews.title: It held everything and stayed dry.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my 20 hr road trip and It was picture perfect. I had so much room that I was looking for extra stuff to put in it. My kids got to pack all they wanted with all that room. I did keep it quite full to reduce wind movement. Drove through rain and all the stuff stayed dry. Very high quality I may get a smaller one the next time. I didn't have to pack anything in my mini van. Oh... I didn't see a difference in fuel with that big thing on top of the van.
customer_reviews.author: Texas guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Like new, was brand new without box. Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought a like new item and it seems to be brand new. Seller is amazing, item revived 4 days ahead of schedule. Will definitely buy from them again. This item is perfect. Last year's trip was a mess driving with a full car and luggage.. This year A+...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moving!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and held so much!! I didn't experience any rain on my trek from Montana to CA, but it seems pretty water resistant and lasted the winds of Oregon! Only issue for me was getting my stuff in and out of it, but that isn't an issue with the carrier. If you pack it with heavy things, as other commenters have said, it holds down just fine! I strapped mine through the doors as I don't have a roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good Gear Bag! 100% Waterproof!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the roof gear bag, but the zippers are a little hard to use. But that being said, it was rained on at several points through our 19 hr. trip and everything in it was dry as promised. Very happy with the purchase. I wish that they made a rigid frame to fit inside it so you could really take advantage of the size. I also wish it came with more straps like 8 instead of 4 and had 2 different lengths.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed; Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, and well constructed. We had six people in the car and plenty of space inside thanks to this. However, this thing is BIG. We had a tough time filling it all the way up and it didn't quite fit between the roof crossbars on our GMC Acadia. It's perfect if you have a larger vehicle or are securing it with just the side rails. They make a couple of sizes; if I could I would probably exchange this one for the 15 cu ft size. Check the measurements front to back and side to side between the rails before selecting your size.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Bag damaged on first use, and leaks badly.
customer_reviews.text: This bag cannot stand up to hard rain. On our very first trip, the bag sustained multiple nicks and cuts all over the front. You could see through some of the holes. I attempted to patch the bag, but our luggage got completely soaked on a 2nd trip. I found a better product to patch it, but that only held up through light - mild rain. The next time we hit severe rain, our luggage was completely drenched with everything inside soaked.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Not safe at all!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this product exactly as the instructions outlined. This product was a dud! It made so much noise during the drive. When we finally got use to the noise, the entire thing ripped off the straps and flew off of our car. We had to back track on the highway to find it. Luckily, not much damage was done to the items inside. Thankfully no one was hurt. It could have been much worse had it flown into a car and caused an accident or even killed someone. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: cory faust

customer_reviews.title: good carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is so so much nicer than the one I had before. Quality of materials feels really good. I like that it can be used without roof racks. I do wish the straps were more substantial in thickness (hence 4 stars instead of 5) but it worked fine for a 18 hour road trip and the straps on my previous cargo carrier were not thicker so they seem to be standard sturdiness by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this product was great I took this product for my move from california to idaho! it was big enough to put a lot of boxes inside. i would say try not to put anything heavy like weights or anything like that like I put a toaster oven which was a pretty big box! the only downfall I would have to say was that the pressure from the wind kept unloosening the belts on the side so we had to tie it really tight and every now and then check if it was moving. Overall this product got the job done!
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, well worth it for a storable solution.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Super heavy duty, highly water resistant through rain. Have made multiple multiple-hour trips with this stuffed full and it’s performed really great. The extra cost is WORTH IT compared to some of the even cheaper options. This first time I took a highway trip and full pack I strapped it down excessively just in case; second time, used only the side straps provided attached to roofracks (parallels, not crossbars) and was still fine on the highway. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality-strap base torn
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to buy this product, that I bought it a little too early to be able to return! We bought this to take on vacation with us, and when we loaded it, then closed and tightened the straps so it was not able to flap around, the strap base tore! I am so disappointed in the poor quality. Hopefully it was just a malfunction of our product, but I’ll never know because I won’t buy it again. I tried to look for the contact so I can see if they would make it right, but I have been unsuccessful. Unfortunately, with the poor quality I have seen, I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Wohlleb

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: We used this carrier when moving from CA to NH. We hit a huge thunderstorm around Oklahoma City and everything stayed dry. As long as you follow the instructions (stuff it full, we used comforters and pillows to make sure) it works great. We also used our own heavy duty tie-downs and we padlocked the zipper. My husband was very skeptical when it arrived, but loved it at the end. We won't need this again so plan om giving it to a friend who does. There is plenty of life left in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lily E-M

customer_reviews.title: This bag ruined Christmas.
customer_reviews.text: My husband strapped this carrier to our 4Runner using the provided straps, carefully following all instructions. He even added our own rope because he thought the straps looked flimsy. As we feared, the the carrier flew off while we were driving on the interstate (roughly 65 mph). Nearly all of our Christmas gifts and personal belongings were destroyed by vehicles driving over them on the interstate. Luckily, the spill didn't cause a wreck, but I'm obviously extremely disappointed that we lost thousands of dollars of merchandise and had no Christmas gifts for most of our family. My advice - you get what you pay for. Spend more and get a quality cargo carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Jupitera

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for tall vehicles. Do not use for a road trip with multiple stops.
customer_reviews.text: The zipper is impossibly hard to zip, and there is no easy way to load this thing with luggage. Maybe flat gear would be easier, but luggage is a no. Unless you carry a ladder with you at all times, putting this on a van or tall SUV is really hard, so this would NOT work for our road trip with multiple stops. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Good roof bag
customer_reviews.text: Good roof bag! If you only have side rails and use this, you may feel better using this with the cross bars as well. There is nothing to anchor the front and back so there was a bit of flapping that worries us. (It was our first time using the bag). We had to stop a few times to adjust but we got the hang of it on our way back to NC from FL, we had to roll the sides to take in some of the slack from the bag and then cinch it down. I would say buy a cargo net to go with this to really take care of the flapping spaces and edges.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for extra storage
customer_reviews.text: This luggage storage was perfect. The large capacity fit everything we needed for 6 people for a week long trip. We had rain and wind along our 1200 mile trip and nothing got wet or shifted. We added an additional strap to the front section crossing it across the front and tying it down. That prevented "lift" and reduced air noise. Easy to take off when we arrived. Compact when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Two trips so far and it has worked like a champ. Even through hours of rain, some so hard the wipers were on max and had to slow down. Had some excessive wind noise but that was fixed by a quick rearrangement of luggage to better fill up the front. No obvious wear yet. Holds a lot more than you think.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this product. The straps wouldn’t hold the bag in place for even an hour of driving. Almost lost the bag and my luggage on highway. If I could give 0 stars I would have done that instead of 1. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Uh-mazing Bag...I love this company
customer_reviews.text: Uh-mazing. Exceeded my expectations. I’m seriously in love with this company now. I drove from Miami, Florida to San Francisco, California over the course of two weeks through 3 rain storms, 90 mph on highways, and going from hot to cold climates. The bag was amazing and the door frame clips worked perfectly. I have a 2013 Prius C without a roof rack And the clips work well.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just used this bag for the first time this weekend for a camping trip. I have a 2012 Fiat 500, which is VERY compact. With the bag completely full of gear, we didn't have much wiggle room in the straps (we ran them through the car, and did not use the car clips). They did go all the way around, but just barely. Drove 2 hours on the Interstate and the bag didn't move an inch. I imagine that if you have a wider car, you'll probably want to buy extra straps, a larger model, or use the car clips. I'm happy with the purchase, and will definitely use again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna T.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Great Support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this carrier in June of 2017 and it worked great the first two trips. Then the third trip, which was in October of 2018, it started to tear in a few places. I reached out to the support team and even though my 1 year warranty had expired, they replaced the carrier with a new one at no cost to me. I appreciate a company that stands behind their products and customers and will support this company next time I need a product that they produce.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: We have used our Rightline Gear Car Top several times now. Overall it is easy to use and we can cram quite a bit into it. I use it on my Ford Escape. We have driven it through sunny days and rainy days and slow speeds and fast speeds and so far it has held up really well!! I really like it! We do make an "x" with bungee cords over it to give it a little more security.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on top of my Mercedes GLK 350. It did not leak in the rain. Our family of 5 used this on 2 trips: to the beach for Easter & for a week of youth baseball in Orlando. We had plenty of room to spare. My only tip is if you use a liner to protect the roof of the car, remember to take it off when you remove the carrier. Otherwise you won't have it for the ride home...
customer_reviews.author: npittman29

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered July 11th and used it on our trip this past week. We traveled 1050 miles and the top of the bag is ripped everywhere. I am so dissatisfied we had it full and the bag was securely fastened but when we got yo our destination there were holes everywhere. I think it's waterproof as long as you don't drive far.
customer_reviews.author: menzoid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect carrier for our purposes
customer_reviews.text: Perfect carrier for our purposes. Holds much more than expected and as it is soft sided, was easier to pack than a hard sided carrier. We liked that when not in use, it folds up to a very manageable size for storing. It was exposed to some rain and we did not discover any leaking inside the carrier. We did use extra straps, but this was because we weren't comfortable about the number of straps it comes with being secure enough, not because we had any problems. Excellent product, good value!
customer_reviews.author: mtnfsc

customer_reviews.title: Completely waterproof rooftop carrier
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip and ended up using it again after that. We drove 15 hours with this on top of the car for the first trip, and 3 of those hours we were driving through the worst storm I've ever driven through. Everything inside was completely dry when we opened it back up. I thought I'd get this for one trip, but it's definitely useful to have around. Recently took it on a road trip just to have more space in the car. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: T P

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect. We were able to pack all that we ...
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect. We were able to pack all that we needed for the trip and to take to my son in the car top carrier and in the back of my Jeep. We drove in rain (was not expected) and everything stayed dry. My only complaint is that the manual was not all that helpful and we had to figure it out by trail and error as to how to attach it to the roof of my car. Glad I made this purchase - made life and traveling so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Sindelar

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great rooftop carrier at a very good price. The 9 cubic foot size holds quite a lot, more than I was expecting, travelled very well and is sturdily made. As my car did not accommodate the straps that came with it , I used two cargo straps through the carrier's side rings and through the vehicle and the carrier sat mostly inside the roof rack rails. I did use a non-slip pad underneath. The whole thing was very secure. Don't hesitate to buy this roof top soft-sided carrier. It's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: flickah

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. I must say it really lived up to it's claim of being very strong and sturdy. We drove from Northern California all the way to Baja California Ensenada Mex. with no problems. The only thing that would make this bag much better would be if the secure straps that it comes with would be a little more thicker for security purpose.Other than that great product and would recommend it to anyone. Best part of it to you can folded away in it's carry bag that comes with it and store it away when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: cesar quezada

customer_reviews.title: Definitely waterproof, can be loud, reduces MPG
customer_reviews.text: Truly waterproof, we put this thing through rain & snow mixed with heavy winds driving east to west & back again, nothing inside ever got any amount of moisture. The only downside to this one is that if you don't pack it just right (can't have any spare room at all) because any parts that aren't perfectly taut will make a horribly loud flapping noise in the wind, we had to adjust a few times because of this, which isn't fun in the cold, but we got the hang of it. Also, it caused our Mileage to go down at least 5 MPG when we were using it, sometimes more.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla M

customer_reviews.title: Poor Instructions of Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: Used this item for one trip and found the instructions were poor and did not explain how to secure the straps and zipper; no cautions for damage to the top carrier. Had to learn the hard way on out trip and the top carrier was damaged because of poor instructions. The wind opened the zipper and the straps flapping damaged the exterior of the cover. I had owed this item for about 6 weeks and want to return it for a new one but cannot due to the poor return policy. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnee

customer_reviews.title: Long-term review: Very good design and very well made product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice carrier when used properly. Fill the bag as much as possible, use a mat to prevent slipping, try to find anchor points a little forward of where the bag sits (it will slide back a little anyway), and make sure the excess straps are tied down or fed back into the door seals. Also you will need a partner to lift the bag onto the top of your vehicle, and if you have anything bigger than a car this will be a chore. When I’ve had problems it was because I hadn’t done one of the aforementioned things. Over several years and multiple uses (1000-1500 highway miles in total) this bag has performed as expected.
customer_reviews.author: SATX_FinGuy

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this product to move items from our summer ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to move items from our summer place to our winter home. I am leaving tomorrow and when I set it up on the roof of my SUV, I find that it will not hold anywhere near the amount advertised. It stated that you can place the equivalent of 10 carry-ons. The size you take on an airplane. I could only fit two carry-ons and two larger suitcases. This is probably equivalent to 6 carry-ons. Not close to what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L.

customer_reviews.title: First impressions good
customer_reviews.text: We just got it and packed it to see what all could fit a double stroller fit just fine with luggage I'm super impressed the 2012 highlander doesn't have alot of storage with 4 kids and one on the way so this will work great for long trips we take over the summer !! Just hope with travel works just as well straps and all I will update later for that .
customer_reviews.author: micheal t.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks durability and broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the durability of this product. The very first time I attached it to my vehicle’s roof, I tightened one of the straps and the backing on it began ripping immediately. On the return drive home (the second time this item is used) one of the zippers broke completely off the item rendering it unusable. For the price I paid expected this to last more than two trips in the car. The only positive was that I drove through moisture in my items stay dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kellon

customer_reviews.title: Hope you dont mind a little wetness
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my daughter making a move from one coast to the other. She was able to fit a lot in it, thats why I gave it 2 stars, but she went through some rain and everything inside got wet. Not only did it leak but the straps and clips had to be clipped over the weather stripping to be secured onto the roof and rain got inside the car as well.
customer_reviews.author: LadyOfTheLoch

customer_reviews.title: Weather tight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This roof top travel bag works great. Moving from florida to Maine over the course of 2 weeks with stops all the items inside it were perfect upon arrival. We had this mounted to the racks on a dodge journey and it held tight no problem. Hit a few patches of rain but all was dry inside. Holds quite a bit of stuff too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I recommend, above expectation
customer_reviews.text: Although it was a pain to pack it once it was on top of the car I have to say that this worked wonderfully. We've used it twice to drive two thousand miles from Arizona to Michigan and then back. One of those trips it rained. The entire drive. Not fun. Our suitcase and bedding was in the bag and I was expecting them to be wet from 38 hours of almost continual rain but everything was dry. Also, if you aren't an idiot, it's simple to use and easy to secure. I have a regular car add it was awesome to have all the extra space during the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just bought our second one
customer_reviews.text: We love this luggage carrier. I just ordered our second one. We bought our first one about 5 years ago and it traveled with us for over 10,000 miles on the top of our Toyota Matrix. It never leaked, even in downpours so hard we had to pull over. We put it up and took it down off out car over and over, somewhere between 40-50 times during our travels. Finally, one of the front corners started to wear thin and we had to retire it after last vacation. I'm sure this new one will also serve our family well.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Dennington

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for a multi hour drive up a mountain
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a multi hour drive up a mountain. I do wish it had a bit more hard of sides because it's just a bag and will flop around if not completely full. Not the product's fault though, it clearly tells you that you need to fill it fully or it will flop in the wind. Also folds up into a nice, compact bag which is included for storage.
customer_reviews.author: N. Head

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME RACKLESS CAR-TOP SOLUTION FOR A FORD FUSION!
customer_reviews.text: Great item and great price! Planned a spontaneous road trip with the folks and traveled 2500 miles in a Ford Fusion with 4 adults. We needed a rackless car-top storage solution for comfort sake, and this onewas excellent! Durable and waterproof, and enough room for 4 large and 2 small duffles - plus! Slight humming as straps loosened and vibrated with the wind, but easily resolved by simply re-tightening. (STRONGLY suggest the optional skid-free matt, too!)
customer_reviews.author: J Coop-Klamer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high quality roof storage!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME!!!! Works perfectly and no roof rack needed. Tip: make sure all the straps are not dangling outside and are tucked in your car so there is no odd sound as you drive. Very stable and sturdy. Well made...did not feel like my stuff was going to fly away at all. I drove from Miami to New Orleans...no prob. Best car buy and amazon buy I have for a long time. It holds a lot more than you think so be conscientious of the weight on your roof!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: I only returned this because I was too scared to ...
customer_reviews.text: I only returned this because I was too scared to use it. I think I have a phobia of things flying off the roof of my car. That said, I handled it some and thought hard about using it for a 12-hour road trip - I tell you this to give credibility to what I'm about to say: this product is obviously very well constructed. If you're NOT afraid of strapping things to your car, this is the way to go. It fits a lot of stuff but it's not bear proof (just a FYI).
customer_reviews.author: ashlel

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and durable! Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a 9 hour drive during the winter on top of a Jeep Compass. There was zero road noise, we had no leaks, and it was super easy to set-up, load, and take down. Also provides a ton of storage space! We didn’t have a roof rack and had zero issues even though it was completely filled.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to drive from Nashville, TN to Cleveland, OH. I packed it with boxes then stuffed clothes around them to keep them from moving. I had it strapped through the van, since our 2002 Honda Odyssey doesn't have a rack. I probable over packed it, but I made sure it looked like the right shape and zipped up. We also used Rightline Gear 100650 Non-Skid Roof Pad. We had a flat tire and almost a second one. Alot of things went wrong, but this carrier was not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tidy

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite As Simple To Use As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to place on my 2014 CRV, difficult to make flat on the roof. Difficult to zip. Worried the entire way as the straps kept loosening. The non-slip pad we purchased for extra cost "SLIPPED" out from under the bag somewhere on I-10 out of Wilcox, AZ. The entire contraption is a good idea but it was noisy, flapping on the sides and in general no substitute for a hard case. Took it off half way though our 3 day trip from LA to Houston and just stuffed everything in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality product. My items were protected from the elements. The zipper is a little hard to slide along the corners so I had to bend the corner flaps the get it moving along. The straps did vibrate as I drove along even after I repositioned them. I never felt the carrier would come off while I drove.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K Slumpff

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this one. I spent hours looking at different options, glad I decided on this one. 10 hour drive in the rain and not a drop penetrated the bag. Very sturdy and folds up easy when your done. Solid buy!
customer_reviews.author: Cord E Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Really well made. Liked the straps and it holds quite a bit. Liked the velcro fold over rain flaps over the zipper. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brent B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cars without racks
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I just drove around 2200 miles with this bad boy on the roof. My car does not have a roof rack, so we used the included hooks. After filling it and taking out the slack in the straps, it was super tight onto the roof of the car. Driving with it is easy and after the first couple hours I stopped worrying about it the rest of the trip. It made it through heavy, heavy rainfall/hail without any leaks. After my long trip there was a lot of bug guts on the front, but washing it took 2 minutes and looked good as new after. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to tie down and holds. Keep things dry after hours on rainy road. Giving one less star for zipper is a little tough and would like a little structure to help keep shape even when packed. - Make sure to pack on car or be able to lift it heavy
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof carrier
customer_reviews.text: Well worth buying. I was a little concerned about whether it was truly "waterproof" but found that despite our driving through a massive rain storm and other areas of rain, the inside was as dry as the day I received it. Most similar products that I found claimed only to be "water resistant" while this one said "waterproof" and it is. One small note; the instructions said to fill it on the ground and then put on top, which we faithfully did, but most likely won't do again because it required 3 very strong people plus extra help to get it up and in place.
customer_reviews.author: Tyoka60

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly, rain ruined several boxes of books.
customer_reviews.text: It demolished on my first 7 day drive with it. Box has no warning for top speed so I assumed 70 would do ok. It held my stuff the whole time but all of the books got ruined by the rain. I don't recommend it unless your drive doesn't put you over 55 then I think it would work well. 1/10 Also Amazon sold my car information, and the next day I started getting calls from very informed people asking about my car. 0/10

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for your money.
customer_reviews.text: We used this not as pictured, but on top of a carrier. This held up really well on our cross country trip from east coast to west coast. It rained the first 2 days and nothing got wet. I did read the reviews and took suggestions. We made sure the zipper side faced the back of the car. We also took no chances and secured it very well to the roof top basket carrier. There were no tears or rips either.
customer_reviews.author: S. Richards

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: We drove from Tucson, AZ to New Braunfels, TX and went 65-80 mph on the highway, drove through 30-40 mph dust storm winds and 3 decent sized rain/hail storms and this bad boy didn’t move an inch. We fit 3 suitcases (large, medium & small), a 10x10 canopy, a bunch of floaties, box of diapers, and a few other miscellaneous things with enough room to shove some more smaller items. We don’t have a roof rack so we strapped ours inside the car doors and other than some wind noise and a little bit of drag we hardly noticed it. Definitely a good buy if you need some extra storage room!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Effective and economical
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a "soft" roof top carrier before buying this one. I wanted something that doesn't take up much space to store since I need to use it infrequently. This really did the job. It was easy to secure to the roof, and it kept everything in place and dry. It was not as easy to load as a hard carrier, but the reward is that it easily folded back into its medium sized storage bag. It is a real bargain for the money, and it works very well. I would recommend buying the roof pad, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in MD

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Drove over 1000 miles round trip to Florida and back to Kentucky. This thing held up well. Two of the Velcro strips came off or I would have given it 5 stars. We did make sure it was full so that there was minimal flapping around of extra material. It held securely and didn't impact gas mileage much. The material is thick and rubberized. The zipper is heavy duty. We encountered very little rain, so I cannot speak to how waterproof it is. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Walls

customer_reviews.title: First time out driving 1300+ miles, from Southwest Florida ...
customer_reviews.text: First time out driving 1300+ miles, from Southwest Florida to Michigan, in searing heat, near-constant driving rain at 70-80 mph through Tennessee and Kentucky and then into near-freezing rain/ice mix and not a drop of water penetrated the interior of the carrier. What can I say, I'm impressed, and relieved as I've heard horror stories about other similar carriers, that your product performed as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME. Bought this last minute for a camping trip ...
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME. Bought this last minute for a camping trip because we couldn’t fit all our gear in one vehicle. We had a 7 hour drive to our destination. On the way we drove through a strong storm with downpour heavy enough to have to pull over. When we unpacked, I was thrilled to discover our gear was BONE DRY!
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Made it cross country
customer_reviews.text: was very skeptical but we made it from Florida to Oregon without a single issue... and that was without racks! We went through several storms too. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof extra storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for extra storage on a camping trip and it worked quite well! Held up well in the rain and over a long night car ride. The only challenge was that we wanted to fill it to make sure it was aerodynamic but then zipping was a bit challenging. We've only used this a couple times, but so far it has held up well! We were able to use a standard lock on the zippers while traveling so we didn't have to worry about our stuff at any pit stops
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: and so it's nice that it folds up small for storage
customer_reviews.text: We used this driving from Iowa to Virginia in winter. We had few problems with it, but it did get a little noisy. We bought the clips and non-slip pad, and attached to the doorframes. We drove through a fair bit of light rain with no moisture issues. Definitely follow the directions for packing properly. We will use this occaisionally, and so it's nice that it folds up small for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag quality, buy ratchet straps
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is excellent quality. Very thick material and wonderful waterproof seams. The zippers and zipper pulls are very high quality as well. The straps, on the other hand, are very sketchy. They are thin, and the hooks which go under the door frame don't really attach to anything. I was very nervous hopping on the freeway with them. They did work for a short (45 minute) drive, but the method to fasten them and tighten them is relatively convoluted. I replaced them with some nice, thick ratchet straps and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: This has worked great on multiple road trips now
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great on multiple road trips now. The first trip it wasn't secured appropriately the first half of it, but once we figured it out, it was quiet and worked well. Would recommend for family trips where you don't want all your luggage in the car with you.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This held up driving 1,500 miles across half the country! It did flap around at first a little but once we drove for a little it settled down, we didn't use the clips and just had it go through the car it worked out well wasn't in the way or very noticeable. I don't look forward to driving 1,500 miles in 30 hours again but if I needed space in a car I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: L.Lara

customer_reviews.title: Saves room but needs work
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this thing on our 800 mile vacation trip. It did make a small amount of noise at higher speeds but it did save us a ton of room in the car which our kids really appreciated. The only bad thing about it is the area below the zipper in the back tore when we were loading up to come home. We had to leave a few things behind because we had no room for it in our car. Very disappointed as this was the first time we’ve used it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Nichols

product_meta.title: Rightline Gear Sport 3 Car Top Carrier, 18 cu ft, 100% Waterproof, Attaches With or Without Roof Rack
product_meta.description: Size:18 cu ft - w/ or w/o roof rackEvery feature of the Rightline Gear Sport 3 Car Top Carrier is designed with you in mind, from its 100% waterproof construction to its engineered Car Clips, which can be attached or removed for use WITH or WITHOUT a roof rack. In just a few steps, you can attach the carrier's straps to a vehicle's roof rack or use the Car Clips to attach the straps to a vehicle's door frame weather molding - the only revolutionary solution of its kind that WILL NOT interfere with passenger headroom. Traveling long distances? No problem. The Sport 3's UV protected PVC Semi-Coated Mesh XT material, welded seams, SZIP waterproof zipper provide a durable, 100% waterproof barrier from the elements. With 18 cubic feet of rooftop storage, you can transport your cargo and your passengers without compromising safety, comfort, or convenience. All Rightline Gear products come backed by a 1 year manufacturer's , so Gear up with confidence! Spend less time dealing with overpriced and overcomplicated alternatives, and more time doing what you love with a Rightline Gear Car Top Carrier.
feature_bullets: 100% WATERPROOF CONSTRUCTION: welded seams and SZIP waterproof zipper; no zipper flap required.
1 YEAR MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY: Shop confidently; our service team is based in the USA & skillfully trained to help you with any questions or concerns.
ATTACHES WITH OR WITHOUT A ROOF RACK: Attach the carrier's straps to a vehicle’s roof rack or use the Car Clips to attach the straps to a vehicle's door frame weather molding.
SMALL CAPACITY DESIGN: 10 cubic feet of storage, 48 L x 36 W x 18 H inches. Designed for compact cars (can be used on larger vehicles).

EASY TO INSTALL: Your bag comes with everything you need to load it up, attach it, and hit the road in minutes! Includes carrier, (4) attachment straps, (4) Car Clips, and stuff sack with sewn-in set up guide.

specifications.Cover Included: Carrier, straps, clips, set up guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,985 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
